Vintage chocolate chip cookies

Ingredients
150g salted butter, softened
80g light brown muscovado sugar
80g granulated sugar
2 tsp vanilla extract
1 large egg
225g plain flour
½ tsp bicarbonate of soda
¼ tsp salt
200g plain chocolate chips or chunks
Method
STEP 1
Heat the oven to 190C/fan170C/gas 5 and line two baking sheets with non-stick baking paper.

STEP 2
Put 150g softened salted butter, 80g light brown muscovado sugar and 80g granulated sugar into a bowl and beat until creamy.

STEP 3
Beat in 2 tsp vanilla extract and 1 large egg.

STEP 4
Sift 225g plain flour, ½ tsp bicarbonate of soda and ¼ tsp salt into the bowl and mix it in with a wooden spoon.

STEP 5
Add 200g plain chocolate chips or chunks and stir well.

STEP 6
Use a teaspoon to make small scoops of the mixture, spacing them well apart on the baking trays. This mixture should make about 30 cookies.

STEP 7
Bake for 8–10 mins until they are light brown on the edges and still slightly soft in the centre if you press them.

STEP 8
Leave on the tray for a couple of mins to set and then lift onto a cooling rack.

RECIPE TIPS
FREEZING THE BISCUITS
If you’ve frozen the biscuits, take them out and arrange them on a lined baking sheet. Once defrosted, pop them in a medium oven 190C/170 fan/gas mark 5 and heat for 2-3 mins to crisp up. Don’t leave them too long or they’ll dry out.
STORING DOUGH
You can keep the uncooked dough in a sealed container in the fridge for up to two weeks. Simply take some out, dollop on a lined baking tray and allow to come up to room temperature for 5 mins before baking

Half Life Thre- I mean HL2:EP1 is a very good continuation of the Half Life series. We see more of the aftermath of the explosion of the Citadel

Half life 2 foi primeiro game que comprei para minha steam assim que tive meu pc. A senção de joga-lo foi incrível, e foi um "blast" tão grande quanto half life 1. Episode one é uma expansão stand alone de Half Life 2 mostrando que valve realmente não sabe contar até 3. O jogo é muito bom mas continua realmente passando a sensação de que ele é apenas uma dlc. Depois de muito tempo finalmente terminei o jogo e gostei bastante. Tem varias seções de adrenalina e mostra como essa guerra que a humanidade está travando contra os Combine. Pelo o preço em promoção o game vale muito, é bem curtinho mas oferece mais half life e a um preço baixissimo.

I never liked ep1 of the hl2 trilogy, the whole game was fun, I just feel like it was a little rushed. I really dont know how to react with this game, its a fun game to play, but its a little bit annoying on some parts. My least favorite part of ep1 was the chapter, Lowlife. Lowlife was the most annoying chapter out of any half life game ive played (besides on a rail). What annoyed me the most was the limited flashlight battery, and the swarms of zombies coming at you, oh, did I mention the limited ammo also? Overall, this game was fun, would recommend it.

Antes que nada, debo decir que solo recomiendo este capítulo porque forma parte de Half Life 2 y es una continuación inmediata de éste. Por lo demás, creo que no sorprendo a nadie si afirmo que de Half Life 2 y sus expansiones, Episode One es sin duda el más flojo. Cojea en muchos aspectos, siendo uno de ellos la duración.
He tardado 3 horas en completarlo, y eso sin prisas. Ya es más o menos lo mismo que Portal, que es un juego entero, pero no hay color, Portal te embriaga 3 horas con su carisma. Éste se siente como un paso atrás respecto a lo visto en Half Life 2.
Sigue siendo Half Life 2, pero pasamos de un juego con mucha variedad de escenarios ( Una ciudad ocupada, unos canales, una costa preciosa, otra ciudad esta vez en guerra, la torre de los Combine, una cárcel reconvertida en base Combine... en fin, un popurrí que de algún modo logra hacer sus transiciones de forma muy orgánica) a unos escenarios en ocasiones repetitivos, con muy poca variedad, y ni la mitad de bien implementados que en el juego base. 

Literalmente, estuve casi un año sin tocarlo desde que llegué a uno de los tramos finales, dónde tenia que ir y venir escoltando a unos cuántos rebeldes mientras venían soldados Combine por el camino. 

Se siente en ocasiones poco inspirado y falto de imaginación. No es una bazofia tampoco.
Como ya he dicho, sigue siendo Half Life 2, de modo que es un gran juego, pero se queda muy atrás de ser una buena expansión. Lo bueno que tiene es que los juegos de Valve suelen estar a un precio más que atractivo. Es de las pocas compañías que se dan cuenta de la edad que tienen sus juegos.

En fin, que recomiendo esta expansión, pero no esperes que sea una gran continuación, y menos una mejora. Ahora, Episode Two, ya es distinto. Ahí si que hay mejoras y nuevos escenarios.

This game will always give me a headache compared to the Base Game. I will always almost hammer my computer and hammer my testicles while playing and trying to finish this game. I find the Beginning with the Black screen and Vortigaunts with the citadel to make me want to head butt my computer. I find the end with the Citizens and the strider irritating and makes me want to Hammer my nuts instead of the computer. The tunnels with the zombies and BUGS MAKE ME WANT TO HAMMER MY NUTS AND MY GOD DAMN COMPUTER. I find the puzzle solving boring compared to Base Game. I HATE THIS GAME AND IT MAKES ME ANGRY AND MAD IT IS SHORT AND IRRITATING. 0/10 I WILL HAMMER MY NUTS IN AND MY COMPUTER AND SHOVE MY COMPUTER INTO MY NUTS IF I PLAY THIS GAME AGAIN.
